I'd like to use these quotes to show the lyrical genius of some hip-hop/rap rock artists: "They dopn't gotta burn the books they just remove them" - lyricists can make a statement, Zack de la Rocha "Light you a blunt kiss your ass goodbye, you gassed yourself, 'cos it's a suicide" - alright they're songs may be about death etc. but geniuses in their own right, Gravediggaz "Brass monkey, that funky monkey" - mix of political angst and random fun, superb, Beastie Boys "Watch as the room rocks, mentally moonwalk. I start my annual talk with my fabled few readers today about something dear to my heart.... comedy. I hve a wide range of comedy influences *not that it does much good* ranging al across the board of the different types of comedy acts that are out there. Firstly isthe late, great Bill Hick's. Not as well known as he deserves, the man is a genius in the way he fuses his biting political satire and breaking apart the fat, stupid american stereotype that so many comics rely upon. He knows that his people are stupid but he can point this out to them in subtle ways, such as the Kennedy assasination. "Hey Bill stop talking about the Kennedy assasination. Its old news let it go. . ." " Ok then you dont talk to me about jesus... i mean shit if we're talking shelf life here. . ." Combined with his political standings lies a razor sharp wit and the ability to deal with hecklers and questions in a way that some comics would never be able to manage. Secondly Jack Dee. The man is the living embodiment of all the bitterness, sarcasm and cynicism that we, as the British people are famous for. The man has the ability to turn everyday things that we all notice into a matter for side splitting laughter. Not only this but he says everything that we have wanted to say, but have been to afraid to do so. For example when he talks about other parents "Our three year olds reading Harry Potter" " Really? ... Well ours is smearing his shit all over the fridge door so..." Thirdly I take Chris Rock. Now some of you may have a shocked look on your face going " But...butkeith ... he's black..... he tells jokes that we dont understand." Ok so none of you are, at least I hope your not or you will taste the back of my hand *judo pose*. Anyhoo, I would like to call him an 'astounding political figure' but he is not. However e explored the stereotypes white people have over black people on one of his tours in his infamous "Black people vs Niggaz" jokes. He tells us that not all black people are how we percieve them, but the niggaz are the ones we shud look out for. "It aint us Chris its the media...... what are you talking about the media.... When i go to a cash machine tonight Im not looking over my shoulder for the media! Im looking for niggaz. . ." "Who's more racist? Black people or white people? Black people you know why...... cow we hate black people too" These men are three influences upon my life and altho i cudnt include the other comics that have made me laugh more than pop 'n' fresh getting poked *please if u have a sick mind shut up at this point*. I could have included many others except for the lack of room. Eddie Izzard, Lee Evans, Peter Kay, Chris Tucker, Cedric the Entertainer, Robin Williams, Jim Carrey and many many more. You may have noticed i have not mentioned any women. This is a subject I will adress at a later date Laters

My time is short on this planet so I should probably be using my time efficiently so that I can get all the things I want to do in the relatively short time available to me. No I'm not gonaa go on a rant about how pointless life is because life doesn't have a point. There is no destiny but what we make for ourselves, and that is a thought I cling to above all others. Basicall some of you out there in amongst the minority of readers i have will be realising that there is not much time left in school and that you wil soon have to be making desicions for yourselves. This, to me at least, is a frightening prospect. Think about it. In a few years I will have left behind a large majority of my friends. Be completely broke due to having o pay for uni and accomadaiton *thank u mam and dad* and more importantly i wil be independent. Independence comes naturally to some but after years of being somewhere that you ont have to worry about cooking, cleaning or payiong bills I dont think that I will sit very well to this kind of life. Also t this time in your life *and by your life i mean... mine* there is that worst case scenario niggling way at the back of your mind: You leave school/college/uni with very few qualifications and have squandered the valuable education you have recieved. Your parents get pissed at you and believe you have pissed ur life away. You have to get a demaning job and will most likely be stuck in that job for the majority of your life. At this point you either train and work from home to try and improve your qualifications so that you can raise up in the ranks and become succesful. Or become content with the life of mediocrity that you now have doing the same job you hate day after day until you eventually rely on something to relieve the boredom/pain. Or even worse commit suicide and be thought of as a coward by all. In my opinion resigning to mediocrity is the worst thing you can posibly do in this life. Its basically giving up early and knowing that you have the talent to succeed, but the lacking the willpower to get up of your arse and do something to change your life. Too many people are far too happy just to sit and wallow in their lives, nopt worrying about the fact that they are wasting the precious time that they have. Anyway thats enough from me for now Im sure that most of you got tired of hearing me repeat the same words over again due to my poor word skils a long time ago anyway :P. Laters

In a vain attempt to try and educate some of the lesser members of the select group that read my blog I will now plaec some poetry on my blog. It is a poem that I quite like........ coincidently some find it dark and depressing altho i dont know why meself. Anyway enjoy.... or dont Do not stand by my grave and weep: Do not stand at my grave and weep I am not there I do not sleep. I am in a thousand winds that blow I am the softly falling snow. I am the gentle showers of rain, I am the fields of ripening grain. I am in the morning hush, I am in the graceful rush Of beautiful birds in circling flight, I am the starshine of the night. I am in the flowers that bloom, I am in a quiet room. I am the birds that sing I am in each gentle thing. Do not stand at my grave and cry. I am not there. I did not die. Yes you may be thinking that this would explain my morbid fascination with death and..... morbid... things..... .Wel ur just scratching the surface baby. Anyhooo Laters

"So keith, do you have a six pack?" Nope thatnks I'm happy with my buffer zone layer ty v much :) Isn't it ironic *subject may not be ironic* that I'm in the happiest mood i've been in for a while. And because of it I'm doing what.... listening to Staind a lot more and writing more than i used to and its generally more morbid. Wierd no? I'm doing this yet i don't fel sad or depressed :s Anyhoo I've been wrting summat for a fw days now and I'm gonna give u a taste of it.....in other words a randomly selected paragraph.... enjoy kiddos ".....Five minutes left. Time has no meaning when your not allowed a watch. Five minutes, ten minutes, three hours. This is the only place on the planet where time is truly relative. You get up when you want, eat when you want, sleep when you want. The perfect life and all you have to give up is your soul and your sanity. They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, well then peace is in the eyes of the insane. He could hear them through the door, he cold hear all. As far of these people were concerned he was God, omnipotence doesn’t mean shit when he was the one holding a gun. James was praying, Susan was crying, and the other two were too shocked to do anything except rock backwards and forwards. All the while muttering, “How could you do this to us? We’re your friends.” “Friends?” The word was like acid to him. “How are you my friends? What, because the same nurse clears away the crap we leave behind?” His voice roze to fever pitch before, just as suddenly as it appeared it died. The storm over for now at least...... " More will come soon when i finish writing this fooker. Peace out kiddos

*cant place my quote of the day here as i like my testicles where they are* It my make me sound morbid but have any of u just had the urge to grap lots of guns.... walk into the centre of town.... and just let loose on some innocents?? I know I have im just intrigued as to whether this is proof of my insanity or a normal thing for me to think. Anyway now that I have your attention/worried looks/horrified stare I can continue........... thats what i would be saying if i actually had anything to say. Im just using this as a delaying tactic so that I dont have to do my maths homework. Hmm i know gather round kiddies and i shall tel you a tale: .... He could feel the cold muzzle of the colt against hisn chin. "What am i waiting for?" he kept asking himself, "no-ones gonna come no-one cares." He stayed stock still, his knees aching from where they had hit the concrete, back stiff from kneeling for too long. The smell of the spent shots lingered in the air, spilling over the back of his ford fiesta and hitting him in the face harder than that bullet ever could. If he didn't end it now it would never be over. . .at least thats what he kept telling himself. But it was true why couldnt he pull the trigger? Why couldnt he end it now and leave just like the rest of his family. Although they weren't really gone, they were surrounding him in a circle where he had laid them to rest. "I'm a coward," he sobbed to himself, rocking backwards and forwards with the gun never leaving his chin. Hewas sobbing so hard he couldn't see the door bust open and the bullet fly towards his face as the police came crashing in. . ." Aaaaaahhh fell so much better now... vented some morbidness... bt i know its not awfully gud but srew you if u dont like it ;). Laters kiddos

"Have you ever felt like a spare tyre?" I postpone my talk on comedians for a later date, for right now im going to talk about something mind blowing... something that will change you life forever........... nah just kiding but now that ur either interested or throwing things at your monitor i can continue. As to why I have not talked about Female comics in my previous blog deelyis is that in my opinion, female comics arent as good. Now before you start lighting your torches and start the long walk to my house in your angry mob to roast me over a fire I urge you to read what I have to say. I am not stereotyping women as unfunny, far from it. I know some who can have me in stiches for hours upon end. French and Saunders for example are superb in what they do. All be it they are not stand up comics fair enough but their LOTR and Harry Potter rip-offs had me near the point of leakage with laughter. *that means near pissing meself i just wanted to add some decorum to this rant* Sandy Toxfig (spelling) is however a ilarious stand up. For those of you who have never heard of her she was on old programs that ur parents *and ill people hu watch daytime tv* i.e. Call my Bluff where she has the ability to spin amazingly funny yarns to put off other comptitors. Her stand up also has the appeal that many of the newer women lack. The women (and im sorry to generalise) in stand up at the moment and for want of a god example ....oooh i dunno ... how about....jenny eclair. For the people out there who do not know who this comidienne is....... lucky u. Ive sen her several times on various shows where she has been introduced as 'ground breaking' or words to that effect. But in my eyes she doesnt have the necessary quick wit to make her funny. Her lines sound all so well rehearsed as if she's been using the same material for many years......... oh wait a minute...thats cos... SHE HAS! Comidiennes similar to this have been springing up in Britain for some time now, using the same material as their male predecessors except throwing in more swearing than a Kev with his cock caught in his zip *enjoy the image why dont you* in a vain attempt to make their old tame jokes sound more funny. And people wonder why a man has won the award for best new stand up for 8 years in a row. Imust concede to that the last one to win it wasthe aforementiond Jenny Eclair but she seemed not to know that u might want to change the 'jokes' as opposed to the swear word count to succeed fuly. Laters

"...and weed is not a drug ne way..." Yes its the old debate that everyone has every so often with ur mates. Whe it comes to this i'm impartial so i get to be the big guy with the funny wig and the small wooden hammer. So to begin *breathes* Yes weed is a drug BUT so are alchohol and nicotine the only difference being that alcohol and ciggaretes have become, to some degre, socially acceptable whereas weed to many has not. (also the two that are not frowned upon are untaxed but this isn't a political rant so i'll neglect to say that ...for now...) I myself would prefer people to smoke weed than smoking a cigarette because at least there doing it for a reason not just bcos they want to look cool and commit suicide over a long period of time. However to some degree cigarettes are better because they have a filter in them but if weed was made legal then shps would sell it in packets and big companies would get in on the act which would make it a business as big as cigarrettes so im sure they could afford filters there. Statistically we we'll all no someone hu does weed..... actually we all know a load of ppl that have done weed however as this is a public site im obligated not to point my finger at those ppl. Anyway my point is that it is THEIR, not ur THEIR life. As none of u are exactly pure to ur inner core i suggest that u not judge others by what thye choose to do. If it doesn't affect anyone and it's a harmless habit why should we become lord and master over other ppl? I myself have never tried weed and probably never will [ my body being the temple it is;) ] but i have nothing against what other ppl do with their lives. However if u do anything harder than weed then ur stupid, if ur gonna go out and do heroin or some shit like that that will probly kill u then go ahead be my guest. Hell im not gonna stop u if u wanna piss ur life away after all its ur choice. whoops stopped being impartial there ..... The moral of the story being, if ppl wanna do weed let them, u have no right to stop them as it is not ur choice its theirs, however if they come to u for help saying they want to give up.... thats when u get involved. Anyhoo sorry to preach cos it aint gonna do a thing. This debate will keep on going forever most likely Laters

Comments would be nice yada yada but i wrote this due to boredom and a mixture of wierd other coincidences. Please pardon the poor grammar etc. Enjoy, or dont *Insert witty name here* Eight minutes. That’s how long he had left. Eight minutes until the police would run in and waste him and free the hostages. It was stupid of him to expect them to pay up, why would they? He had only taken four people and there was plenty more where they came from. After all, how much would their families miss them when they've shoved them in a nuthouse like this? No visitors here because nobody cares, not their families, not the pigs at the door and not even themselves. Ironic in a way, the pigs were coming to blow his house in and he, the wolf would be the one that got blown away. He felt the blood trickle from the cut on his leg, staining the white hospital gown a bright crimson, the luger a dead weight in his hand. The realisation crept over him like a swarm of locusts on the fields he had spent so long spraying in his uncles blue plane. He couldn't remember the make, he couldn't remember much anymore since the 'treatment' from Dr Maloy. All he knew is that he wanted to get out, and get out now. Five minutes left. Time has no meaning when your not allowed a watch. Five minutes, ten minutes, three hours. This is the only place on the planet where time is truly relative. You get up when you want, eat when you want, sleep when you want. The perfect life and all you have to give up is your soul and your sanity. They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, well then peace is in the eyes of the insane. He could hear them through the door, he cold hear all. As far of these people were concerned he was God, omnipotence doesn’t mean shit when he was the one holding a gun. James was praying, Susan was crying, and the other two were too shocked to do anything except rock backwards and forwards. All the while muttering, “How could you do this to us? We’re your friends.” “Friends?” The word was like acid to him. “How are you my friends? What, because the same nurse clears away the crap we leave behind?” His voice roze to fever pitch before, just as suddenly as it appeared it died. The storm over for now at least. He took a look at his companions, sitting in their respective corners in their blue robes trying to place them. He knew their names; Susan, James, Martin, and Jackie. Apart from that, he knew nothing. Were they married? Did they have kids? Where did they come from? Who was their favourite nurse? He knew none of this even though he had talked to them about those very things several times. Except of course for the last question. The favourite nurse was Lucy; she was everyone’s favourite nurse. She was in her late twenties, brunette, tall with bright blue piercing eyes that could be fierce like a wolf, or soothing like a sunset. He wouldn’t say no anyway. Always a smile for everyone, taking time to talk to them and cheer them up when their families didn’t turn up when they said they would. Not like the other nurses. All 6”2, broad, blond and with faces that looked as if they’d been set on fire and put out with a spade. They had gruff voices and that, combined with their mannerisms gave the impression that they had been spawned from the loins of Hitler. Although it had been so long, he wouldn’t have said no to one of them either. Three minutes. The countdown was agonising, wearing away his mind like hungry rats. They obviously didn’t believe that he would do it. “I’ll show them,” he sneered, “I’ll show them all.” He looked to his fellow actors in this play called life. Two choices faced him; he could set one of the hostages free to show that he was willing to co-operate. Or he could ‘release’ one of the hostages from their torment. A small snicker turned up one of the corners of his mouth as a thought creeped into his mind. “So…” he asked, not bothering to keep the sneer out of his voice, “Who wants to be released?” The squad cars had been silenced a long time ago. The only sounds in the office were of the negotiators deciding upon their next move and the coffee percolator bubbling in the corner. The tension was evident on everybody’s face. The once immaculate shirts of the F.B.I had long since been replaced by sweat stained rags with ties loosened down to their ankles or in some cases lost completely. But they were nearing the end; swat teams had been posted at all entrances to the building all with itchy trigger fingers and tense nerves. Three minutes was their latest estimate, they were just praying that he would call again. They all stared transfixed at the phone on the desk, and when it began to ring took a step back in shock and surprise. “Hello?” asked the officer. “Yes,” came the snake like response of the hostage taker, “I have decided to release one of the hostages.” There was a pause as everyone in the room let out a small sigh of relief. He continued, “I will release… …Jackie.” He crashed the phone into its cradle and walked back to the room that he had forced them in. He took his time and sung a nursery rhyme he vaguely remembered his mother sang to him, his footsteps keeping in time to an eerie beat. “ Oranges and lemons say the bells of St Clements…” He opened the door, “You owe me five farthings say the bells of saint Martins…” He started up the stairs. “When will you pay me say the bells of Old Bailey…” He loads the clip into the gun. “When I grow rich say the bells of Shoreditch…” He loads the chamber and clicks off the safety. “When will that be? Say the bells of Stepney. I’m sure I don’t know say the bells of Saint Bow…” He slipped the key into the lock and turned the key. The bolt made the corridor echo as he stepped in, singing at the top of his voice now. “Here comes the candle to light you to bed and here come the chopper to chop of your…” The shot could be heard by all. They never thought he’d shoot one of them, what was he doing? He said he’d release one of the hostages, this didn’t make any sense. The silence was awe-inspiring; the only sound you could hear was the irregularity of your own breath that comes with shock. Until finally the deputy said what everyone else was thinking. “Fuck…” At that instant the phone began to ring and trembling, agent Mavarian picked up the receiver. “H-hello?” “Good. I’m guessing by the stammer in your voice that I shocked you.” He paused briefly, “if you meet my demands and free me with no warrants against my name. If you let me be truly free, then you need not worry about your precious hostages.” “We need more time…” It even sounded pathetic to him, the oldest cliché in the book. The man merely sneered down the phone and hang up. The silence returned, not a silence forged of shock, but one of contemplation. You could hear the thoughts flying across the synapses until one of the junior officers voiced his opinions. “Why don’t we just give him what he wants? We know he’s capable of killing the hostages, he’s shown us that much.” The older officers around him looked at him with a mixture of disbelief, rage and pity. “This is America boy,” one said patronisingly, “that’s not the way we do things.” As if encouraged by this the other officers became a hive of action, telling swat teams to ‘hold tight for the moment’ and ordering their double latte’s with sprinkles. After all it could be a long night and it would be hell for them without their latte’s. They had barely noticed what he’d done. It was as if she had never been there, never existed at all. Although this was true for them all, it had been for a long time. It’s just like the old proverb: If a tree falls in the wood and no one’s around. Does it make a sound? If one of us were to fall, would anybody notice? Would any of us be heard? So as he sat there, covered with a mixture of his and Jackie’s blood he felt the sudden realisation that it didn’t matter if he killed a hostage. They would still rush in and take him down; because nobody cared about his hostage’s, they were worthless. “When will you people listen!?!” He screamed to the empty corridor, the echoes sounding like the diminuendo of an out of time choir, just like the one at his wedding. Then the thought struck him; he was married! “Sarah…” he could remember their wedding day… …then he said, that’s ok I didn’t even want the beer!” Father was keeping the crowd amused with another of his stories of old. Regaling the with adventures he’d had gallivanting around the globe instead of being where he should have been, where he was needed. He wasn’t bitter about it, after all Father was paying for all of this, Sarah’s parents having died when she was very young and his mother running away as soon as he was put into boarding school. No I wasn’t bitter that he forgot countless birthdays and never had time for me, why would I be? All he wanted to do was grab the knife that they’d used to cut the cake and plunge in deep into – “Hey Mark!” It was Bill, Sarah’s brother. He was a likeable chap, always willing to help out if you needed it and had the unique ability to make anyone laugh. He smiled only the second true smile of the day, the first being when the fat kid fell over into the holy water. Whose kid was that anyway? “So how’s the budding new groom doing then?” he tried, but inevitably failed to keep the edge of sarcasm that he was so accustomed to. That’s why he liked him, he was always himself, never tried to hide who he was, if only he could be more like that… “You ok Mark?” he asked, “you look pretty bummed for a man who just married a model.” He merely stared at the floor and shrugged. “C’mon man lets go get some drinks.” He continued to stare at the floor. Why did he feel so scared? This was the best day of his life what was there to worry about? He shook the thoughts out of his head, smiled and said, “Yer sure, after all she’s already passed out.” He pointed to the blue Cadillac that was now home to his heavily saturated wife…. He was awoken from his reverie by the sound of the phone ringing in his hand. He didn’t want to answer; he wanted to go back. Back to a time he could barely remember but he didn’t care where it was as long as it was better than this. It kept ringing, the high pitched shrill burrowing away into his head. “Hello?” He asked to the receiver, sounding like a small child without his mother. “Sir. We are willing to give you what you wish.” His voice sounded raspy like he’d been gargling with bleach, even his superior noticed. They waited for the reply hoping that he took the bait and they could finally end this. “Sir?” He asked. All they could hear was the sound of him breathing softly like a sleeping baby. He could picture him curled up in the corner of the room with a blanket over him, a scared man not sure what he’s doing in this life. That was, until he heard the laugh. It started as if he was coughing but it soon developed into a fully-fledged cackle. It was scary to imagine someone making that noise; it was something you expected from old horror films but not from anything human. “He’s flipped,” came the voice of one of the juniors at the back of the room. “Oh really?” asked agent Mavarian patronisingly, “What makes you think he was oh so sane to begin with? He’s in a god-damned mental hospital isn’t he?” This silence the room, Mavarian rarely spoke and never spoke with anger. The tension he was under became obvious, second divorce, supporting a kid he never got to see, failing to get promoted and having to return to his old rotting apartment every day. There was a man who needed this to go right, and it had already gone badly wrong without a hostage being released. He picked up the receiver, the maniac laughter dying down to background noise. “Look,” he said matter-of-factly, “Just relea-,” he stopped himself in time, “let one of the hostages go and we’ll get you what you want.” Again silence reigned in the organisation room as he began to speak. “What I want… how do any of you know what I want…” This brought many perplexed looks from the police officers cramped into the small communications room. “But… your demands?” Mavarian said delicately into the phone. “Oh those. Well I’m sorry but I’ve changed my mind. I’m afraid that you can’t provide me with what I want.” “And what is that exactly?” Mavarian asked, the familiar sneer returning to his voice. “Peace…” He threw the phone into the air and with one well placed shot, blew it into fragments. He watched mesmerised as the pieces of circuit board, packaging and wires flew across the room, not caring when the door to his left burst open and a flood of large men holding riot shields, with their rifles raised surrounded him in his corner. “Put the gun down!” “Hands behind your head!” “Lie down on the floor!” The orders cam thick and fast, he ignored them all. He realised that he had lost, he would never find peace. He raised his head to look at the nearest SWAT member and looked at him like an abused puppy looks at its owner. He looked down at the gun he held in his hand, it seemed obvious what he should do. Peace would come to him in eternity, he would finally find out who he is what he did in his life. He smiled and spoke, “Ironic in a way, the only time I’ll ever be free is when I’m trapped underground in a box.” The SWAT team looked perplexed as they stared at this man his face covered with someone else’s blood yet contorted in a peaceful smile before in a smooth angular motion he raised the gun to his temple and pulled the trigger. *Click* The smile vanished. His only way out and it had disappeared. He swore out loud as agent Mavarian walked into the room, his bulk shifting as he struggled to walk. The fitness tests obviously didn’t apply when you got a desk job. He was frantic, he had to get out, they were closing in on him wolves pouncing on a cornered rabbit. *Click* *Click* *Click* he was desperate. Mavarian edged closer towards him, his footsteps a countdown heard above the shouting of the guards, the smug look of arrogance firmly set between both ears. He was the cat who’d got his cream, a kid with a secret. He wouldn’t let him win, not when he’d got so far he was so near the end. He noticed the SWAT guns were still trained on him watching his every move like empty soulless eyes. He laughed the same laugh that made all of them shudder like the cowards they claimed not to be, he could see it in their eyes, they were afraid. He stared at the nearest one looking into his light blue eyes seeing the child he had not long left behind. The man must only be 20 a mere boy, new to the world of death and destruction his life would become. This was probably his first job, the first time having to look upon a real face when he pulled the trigger. Then looking closer he saw the reflection that was himself, lying in his corner covered in another humans blood, unsure about who he was and why he was here, only sure that he had been rejected but not knowing why. He was overcome by his own self-pity, which in turn quickly became a seething rage, he was angry at himself, angry at the police that stood over him but angriest at his father. It burned inside of him willing him to do it, to free himself from the torment and with his final thoughts of he rushed the officers… ... He soon thought no more. Fin If ur disturbed consult a doctor, if ur scared good, comments helpful

hmm.. why dont i liven things up and talk about god? I'm an aethiest and am in the firm belief that even if there is a god, he's screwing me around. I will now try to explain to you all the purpose of god, heaven and the majority of religions. Strap urself in or get lost God was, in my view, another of mans creations to try and give the people hope, and to give them something to work for. In early times this meant that Gods were there to justify why you were supposed to do something because it was gods will. By this i do not mean that the rulers invented god to rule over their people, i mean that the people themselves thought of their god/gods as their reason to do what they were doing. This lead to the invention of the various different cultures 'heavens' which was giving reason to a confused masses as to why they died (similar to the invention of time.... but thats another subject) this meant that death would not be meaningless to these people and if they would be in paradise with a loving god then they would live their lives better. Also the creation of the various hells, provided reasons as to why people could not do what they wanted. It was created so that people on the whole would not do 'evil' things because they would be shunned by the almighty and suffer an eternity of torture. This would be enough to discourage anyone from an improper lifestyle. So does god exist? In my opinion there is no God, no heaven, no hell but tbh i have no idea as to what happens at death. However to the people religion and god brings hope to and makes their lives have purpose then yes, he is a very real person indeed. He gives them a real explination as to what is happening in their lives and potrays infinite forgiveness. So there ya go.. will it solve anything? no... do i care? no Laters

I have never had a film move me to tears, it is a thing i have due to my stunted emotions. So alas i did not cry when watching Regeneration, although i was moved by it. As a film it was one of the most thought-provoking i have seen in my lifetime coupled with one of the most emotional experiences i have ever seen. This is supported by the unflinching realism that is portrayed throughout, reminding you that this is based on real experiences and real lives. This makes it all the more moving to watch as you pity the people who have suffered something we can only begin to imagine. It goes right up there with shawshank redemption as one of my favourite films i've seen, I recommend it to all. Laters

Writing time.. i felt like writing another thing for the hell of it so thats what im doing now: (this is complete improv so i apolagise for the crapness/suicide it induces) Burnt spoons and boiled carrots He smiled. It was the first real smile he'd had in a long time, unless you count the smug ones he got when he saw someone fall over or tricked his brother into saying something stupid. He didn't know why he was happy, well he did but he didn't really believe it. Funy thing that really, humans define our lives by how much misery we feel, yet we feel the most alive when we feel nothing but happiness. This was what he tried to tell his psyche tutor but was only greeted by "...and how many times have you seen the matrix?" He didn't care anymore though, he had what he wanted, he had all that was needed. He smiled again as he patted the bulge in his left jacket pocket. It was cold against him, the end diggin into his ribs, not hard enough to hurt but enough to remind him that it was there. He had his headphones in and was listening to another metal band shouting at him, giving him a reason to be, giving him something to hold onto. Their lyrics might be as deep as meaningful as horse shit, but it was all he had at the moment. The taunting had gotten worse at college, people yelling at him all the time because he didn't look like them, becuase he didn't act like them... because he wasn't one of them... They went home everyday to their nice apartments that their parents had paid for and ate their nice food that their girlfriends cooked for them. What did he go home to? Burnt spoons and boiled carrots. He scratched his arms at the memory, before smirking again. His own little victory against the world every time they didn't notice, not that they noticed much about him, nothing positive anyway. He felt the leaves crunch underneath his feet as he walked to visit his parents. He always enjoyed the walk to see them, the brown and yellow leaves falling. dancing in the wind to the sound of a mute choir, the small animals running in front of him a long the path, the grey squirrels calming him with their scurrying. It was nice to be out here every so often amongst the trees and the wildlife, to get away from the smog and machinery that was his home in the city. He wondered why they had wanted to be out in the open this far, supposedly the same reason he liked it, it was far away from anything that was common to them. He saw the meeting spot in front of him, the old buildings spires rising up aheadof him. This was the part he always dreaded, when he finally talked to them. He gritted his teeth and walked up the cobbles and then along the row. He knelt down at the end said what he always did, "Long time no see..." Their was no response, there never was, after all they were buried six feet under and he was just talking to a marble block. He didn't mind though, he used to, there were the nights when he spent ages lying in bed at night wondering why had it happened to him, what had he done wrong, did he deserve it? The only thing left to him was the toy car that his father had left him, beautifully crafted out of silver it reflected the light in such a way that it made you think it was worth a fortune. However with time it had dulled and the shine had become forgotten, much like all things did with time. He loked again at the grave, "Y'know.. there was a long period where i thought i hated you" he began, "But then i realised it weren't your fault. It weren't your fault that they picked on me, that they beat me it was theirs and im gonna make them pay." He felt the bulge again, just to make sure it hadn't gone anyway. "It's ok dad i know what I'm doing, i know how I'm gonna deal with it. Hopefully I'll bne able to talk to you again real soon, even though i wont be able to see you..." A single solitary tear rolled down his cheek, splashing onto his shoe like the dew drops of a new morn. He stepped back and looked at the tombstone and read the inscription "They died how they had always lived.... together" He had always loved his parents and the fact that they took their own lives was something he never forgave them for, until now. He had realised over the past few years what they were living through, the hell of being hated by both families, frowned on by the general public and spat on by the higher classes. Hell he'd even thought of it a few times himself. The tears were flowing fully now, streaming down both cheeks in a tidal wave of emotion, "I ...I don't blame you" he spluttered before reaching into his pocket to feel the cold metal touch his sking. He grabbed hold and drew it out of his pocket... ...he sttopped crying and wiped his tears with his other arm, his other hand warming the metal slightly. He stepped forward to the tombstone and placed the model of a silver racing car onto the pedastal. Before waving goodbye to his parents, "Until next year..." he muttered to himself, "Happy Birthday Dad" he said to the rock, before putting the headphones back in his ear, and making the trek back to the awaiting city. Woah...... id like to apolagise to any of you that read that.... i got bored ok???? Laters

It was one of those "do i like this? ...i can't remember" moments so i had some anyway. Suffice to say i remembered why I'm not tere biggest fan. (Although as i was hungry - it was appreciated) 1) The thing on the box is a big yellow hairy monster. This is far too similar to my dad to be healthy, and seeing its face at 10.30 (or whatever) in the morning after getting 5 opr so hours of sleep is not a good way to start the day 2) "Puffs of wheat dressed in a little honey jacket" The idea that my food should be personified and should be dressed properlyfor the occasion is a sombering thought for me. I don't like the idea of wheat being dressed for my dinner in its best jacket... especially when it doesn't taste like honey :s 3) You have to eat them rapidly - they after two minutes or so become water... well milk-logged [and if anyone says anything biology related i'll kill 'em ;)] This reduces them to a kind of mush with all of the "flavour" running out into the milk. This ...suffice to say leads to a not particularly well tasting snack. However you can put sugar on them - which perks up any meal, but with any cereal this leaves you with a see-through syrup (sp?) that decays ur teeth to nothingness. Yes.. so another random rant to ad to the list. Now i must sleep as i am very tired, that'll explain any poor grammar or spelling mistakes... that and my normal retardishness (i dont know). Laters

I decided to try and write somethign a little longer as opposed to a short, and I am succeeding. Here is the first page so far - theres a lot more to come kiddo's [ NB: bare with the beginning it's not representative ;) ] "....He turned the volume up on his stereo, letting the soothing sounds of various metal bands drown him in their songs of hatred and greed. He couldn’t remember why he felt bad or why his stomach was churning over, but he knew there was a reason. Why couldn’t he just sit up and stop paying attention to all the crap around him. Why couldn’t he just stand up and shout till his throat hurt like he wanted to, or walk over to him and punch him square in the face until his nose broke. These were the things he wanted, the things he longed to do but alas instead he just sat there, up to his knees in self pity looking out the window at the world that could have been…" I sighed under my breath. It was another one of the stories I’d been sent by a self pro-claimed ‘aspiring writer’ wanting to use me as his test subject. I just laughed to myself and threw it into the rubbish bin next to me. The last thing anyone wanted to read was another piece of angst from a bored middle class teenager. So where does this leave me? I’m sat in a coffee-house sipping my massimo mocha latte… whatever it’s called and reading through the rest of the hopefuls. The world was passing by the windows as I looked out, whiling away the hours. A mother with her two children, pushing the buggy with the younger, more docile child held within. All the while making sure the other child did not accidentally smother it with his jumper that he’d got tired of holding. It was a scene any family man saw, the bickering between mother and son, the love of the mother shining throughout, not always visible but undeniably there. On the other corner there was the other side of life; a young girl of about 10 years disguising herself as 16 or older. This was the saddening thing about what was happening today, people growing up too fast – childhood not existing anymore. I smirked to myself, It’d always amused me how up until the age of about 25 you strive to make yourself look older, to try and be accepted by the people you saw in magazines and on TV. Then suddenly, you became almost neurotic in thinking you looked too old, you suddenly wanted to capture the youth and childhood you had thrown away so easily in early life. I’d never really grown up, or so I was always being told. Parents, friends, teachers and later professors and bosses always asking, ‘When are you going to grow up?” To these people I always gave the same reply; “Never, I hope.” I pushed my musings to one side as I saw the family walk past the café and continue down the street towards the subway. The bag next to me however hadn’t moved, and was full with more short stories and reviews from the fan base, all asking for critique and ‘insight into the mind of a writer’. It was this very thing in itself that annoyed me, the way that I was supposed to be deified for using my imagination. Everyone is capable of writing, all it takes is time and a good imagination. Hell, I was far from well trained in the matter – I’d been studying chemistry at Birmingham Uni. for Christ sake! I sighed to myself and picked up the next folder, before re-ordering my fourth coffee of the day. ‘Dear Mr. Stevens.’… I had made several books by now, some of which this person has read other wise my opinion would be nothing. Surely he must realise it’s spelt ‘Stephens’? The mind boggles, it really does. I carried on reading regardless. ‘… I ask for your advice on a piece I have written. It is a short I wrote during a troublesome time and this was my way of dealing with it. - Mark Hallcourt, aged 15’ ‘I was cold. So very cold. The warmth of the world had been sucked away from me, the emotion-vampire draining me of my spirit. I sat on my bed curled in a ball, lying there confused I wondered about what was happening in the world outside me. Friends that were passing me by, I hated myself, I hated my parents, hated everyone in fact. I wish the pain would just go away…’ “Oh bollocks to this!” I shouted, disturbing some of the other drinkers and making one old man nearly spill his cocoa. “Trouble in paradise ay John?” A smirk blazoned across my face. The same old cliché’s everyday, yet somehow with him they never became tiresome. “Still repeating what you say are we Tommy?” I swivelled around in my chair, it was one of those steel one’s with wooden latticework, very artistic but made your back hurt something chronic. He was dressed just as he always was; the familiar baggy, dark blue jeans, ragged grey T-shirt and battered brown duffel coat. It was his uniform of a type, you never saw him without it. It was what people like him were destined to always wear. “How goes the house hunt Tommy?” The smirk was still in place, the joke we always shared when I saw him. “How goes the diet?” he retorted, his own face now smiling along with me. “Ah touché,” I replied, looking down to see that he was right, I could stand to lose a bit of weight. Just being a writer wasn’t a particularly physical job, at least it wasn’t for me anyway. Anyhoo.... thats that done, more will be posted when its done.. mebe. Criticism welcomed etc. Aloha
I apolagise to anyone I have offended with my previous posts. Next time I'll just keep what I'm thinking to myself like I normally do.

*Ive just read what i wrote... you may not want to bother as its boring and pointles... dont say i didnt warn u!* Im sat here at my dad's computer bord off of my tits. I find myself sitting here and wondering how I came to be the person I am, what happened in my life that made me how i am today. I have no great depressing life story, I have no life of amazing wealth I am mediocre. I am mediocrity with a superiority complex. Hmm... time to explain myself to y'all i spose. Hi my names Keith I'm an angst-aholic, I've been clean for going on a week now. I find myself spending a lot of my time trying to make myself not think. I read books and learn about other peoples lives, get caught up in storylines because they're more interesting than life. I spend hours listening to music to try and distract myself, holding in al the anger I feel just in case I let off in any direction like a pent up fire hose. Why am I angry? what do i feel inside? Hell i dunno myself thats why I sit and wonder. I once had someone say 'Your too deep for you own good' ...can't remember who it was but it stuck in my mind. However I can't say any of this to any of you in person because of the way I am. I'd just say "I'm fine" before making a sarcastic comment to detract atention away from whatever it was we were talking about. I could rant on about the government and the way that, without knowing it, we're being screwed over every day of our lives, but that would either open your eyes, or make you opinions of me crash into the ground.... ironic as this is probably just what writing this is doing. My life stories uneventful 'A wedding and four funerals' about sums it up. My life was backwards my parents didn't care... Now thats what u were expecting right? Well thats not it, i have a damn good life in comparison to other people. and as for my experience with death - i know they ll had damn gud lives too. I've said before now that I do not fear death itself, but the wasting of a life. I am not a religious man, i do not follow a strict faith. I question God's existence whenever I see news of famines or wars or when a young child is kidnapped and worse... It is the old question that people have never really been able to answer 'If God is real, then why is there so much suffering in the world?' They explain it by saying 'God is merely testing us' ..... no he's not, he's killing us! Like in the book of Job, it is shown that God is capable of being a bastard, which is not an aspect i want in the man that is judging whether i have had a good life or not. In the ways of god so far the best way of belief I have hard has been the Mormon religion to be honest. You die and go to a limbo with all of your friends and family - to a place where time is relative so you all appear to arrive at the same time. You then wait until the end of time where you pass on to another plain of existence and become a god yourself. Ignoring the slightly cult-like ways of this, it seemse to be a pretty positive way of thinking about death. Why do we have wars? Humans as a species are unique in the way that we hunt animals for sport, whereas they do it merely to get their next meal. However, like these animals we fight to the bitter end to protect our territory from invasion. This is what past wars have been about (WW1, WW2). Then the nature of warfare changed, men weren't doing the fighting against other soldiers - they were dropping bombs on innocents who on the most part wanted nothing to do with the wars. Im using the gulf wars as my main example here. Now as for how we're being screwed over. We are the most heavily taxed country on the planet (its like the old saying '60% of all figures are made up on the spot:P) and if we are not, then we are one of the most heavily taxed in the world. This would in itself not be a bad thing if we had decent services. 'Oh but we have the NHS' .... so? We have a free service yes, but a free service that is patheitcally treated and cause people to go private. The government just throws money at it and prays it'll go away. I take as my exampl when i wrenched my ankle last year. I arrived hobbling into casualty supported by my brother and hopping over to the desk i sat down. I was, not to sound melodramatic, in a rather large amount of pain. The woman behind the desk then proceeded to take my details and add to them my age etc. She then presented me with a chart of faces.. cartoon faces with different expression ranging from :D to a very angry face indeed. This was my 'pain guide' and i was to ppint to which one looked the best. Bear in mind i am wearing a slipper two sizes two big, a coat that isnt mine, my school clothes and one leg of my trouser rolled up.. now here i was pointing at faces on a fucking chart. It's nice to be look an utter twat i shud do it more often... (ythe ironys there kiddos exploit it).I then was asked 'Can you walk' to which the answer was a polite 'NO YOU DAPPY BITCH' ...Well actually it was a 'no i cant' but hey. I was then told that they had no more wheelchairs left ... this was a hospital, an accident and EMERGENCY ward... with no wheelchairs. Instead i was presented with a wooden chair with a seabelt which loked like i was riding a book troley. There was also no wher to put my feet and the wheel didnt work so i had to be dragged. So i waited.. and waited... a half hour later my painkillers arrived after the reception had dealt with a total of... nobody. So then another hour and a half later the doctor sees me. I am dragged - with my foot dragging along the floor which did not help my ankle any. Suffice to say it wasn't a fun experience - i wont go into the toils of x-rays for now as i have probably written too much anyway. That shows a portion of why I'm biter towards the NHS .. but not the rest of the world. My predjudice towards women - the onyl girls in my old school were on the whole slags. They would play the boys off against each other and would take a role of dominance.. ironic for the times. Anyway i was the young innocent Keith back then, I was also a loner. I had the friends and all but I'd find excuses not to hang with them, excuses why i wouldn't be like the rest of them. I was the bitter sarcastic one who sat at the table and waited for ppl to slip up (every school had one). To put it bluntly, i wasn't a very nice person and in some respects I'm still the same evil bastard I always have been. Anyway i digressed.. the women i grew up with were bitches.. i could elaborate but id rather not and hell ive written too much anyway. Why i dislike authority and the government - I have always been distrustful of any authority figure, you just know that when they;re up on that podium preaching about how they're going to fix all the problems that previous pppl have left behind that they're just preaching to the crowd. The world is one great big propaganda machine and we're taking in all of its bullshit. (do i sound like an anarchist or a hippy... no just a raving idiot as per usual). Not to go on shouting and ranting angsty bullshit.. but im gonna anyway. Im not gonna say that all people are lying to you I'm not paranoid. All you have to do is take the things people say with a pinch.. or sometimes a shovel full of salt. This is because very often they are just saying what they think you want to hear - not actually what they think or what is happening in truth. Anyway I think I've ranted enough for one day ... even though I've written god knows how much and explained so very little... ah well one day lol.

I just spent the best part of half an hour running walking, and sitting on an electrical station (the green metal blocks on the side of the roads). It gave me time to think, reflect and ponder about the future and what this holds for me. The reason? Well my oh so loving parents have just told me that probably at the end of this year I will be moving to scarborough, in the north of England... 300 fucking miles away... So thats just hunky dory. After a damn good week-end of hanging with Ollie, Will, Hannah and Jen in MK, along with Ollie's crew and Erwood made a camio appearance randomly. Well it is in the North of England 30 miles ish away (which i think i covered). Altho it does have a beach and a row of arcades and as my dad keeps telling me 'a good sixth form college' ..immediatly followed by 'but not as good as a grammar school'. The point is self-evident isn't it really? If its better from a grammar school... THEN WHY CAN'T I STAY THERE! Damn logic, even when it works in your favour some people don't get it =/. So why do Inot want to move to this sea-side resort and leave this 'crap-hole' as i call it so often? Because i like the taste of shit. I like this town and i can't imagine living anywhere else. I often say this but it's actually true. I'm not the best 'people person' in the world and making friends does not come easily to me. I want to stay on for a-level and enjoy my study leave we get by hanging with mates and people i already know. Not by sitting around trying to make friends with new people. New people... ergh... Altho there is a large plus side that I would quite like. Takign my acoustic guitar to the beach and sitting out on a rock with my fet dangling off the edge, strumming away as i watch the seunset and hear the soft sound f the waves breaking around me, my feet adbbling in the water. Now that would be sweet.... Anyhoo I know that I can be a bit of a burden to carry and that sometimes I'm not really the best of company to keep and I'm gonna use this time to apolagise. I'm at school, 'Learning'. I say learning... because if i was actually learning I wouldn't be on here now would I? What am I doing then. Well I'm updating my log, what a stupid question.. the reason why however is beacuse i have less than half of my IT class present at school today. I am in a class of... wait for it... 5. Erwood says... ''GOD I HATE MR WILLIAMS!!!". Thats it 5 people, my chemistry calss was 6, my french was 6, my Maths was roughly 15. I am in a dictatorship, I expect good ol' Adolf to pop out of the staff room smoking a cigar and laughing at all of us. That small moustache bristling up and down on his chin. The teachers agree with us.... which is rare. They seem to think that this is a pointless excersise and a shambles. They want to be out as much as we do, Mrs Furney even says 'I wish i was out sledding'. (Erwood wishes it to be known he finds this, and me mentally unstable). We are not allowed on the field, as that is counted as 'fun'. We are not allowed in our classrooms, because that is counted as 'shelter', we have teachers guarding the exits from our school to make sure we don't leave our classes and perhaps go home..... like everyone else in Buckinghamshire. We have less than half the school here, hell Id be surprised if we had a quarter of the school here. But we cannot leave, me musn't, we might miss out on some valuable education.... such as the sorting books and sperating large chunks of chalk from smaller ones in chemistry. I give it a week. A week until we have to paradethe quad singing, 'All hail the new Fuhrer' and eating bratwurst while sucking down some good old fashioned Saurcraut (sp?). It's only a matter of time before the new shower block is installed.... HAIL FUHRER

I just got back from eating, my chippy has damn good chips :D. Have been outside in the snow playing with me mate ash and some other random ppl i know. .... Call me immature if u wish, i just dont care. It's fun to be out in the snow. On another note .. though it will become related later. Do I intimidate you? Does my height make you somehow think 'I have to prove myself against him' (this is mainly to the dudes, but to all of you). No? Yes? Now picture yourself as a twenty year old man...... would you find me as a person intimidating. I am a sixteen year old lad, ok i may be tall and ..altho I seem strong to you lot, its nowt compared to most blokes. But why does this mean that men older than me feel a need to prove that they are tougher than me. It is somethign that vexes me greatly. This culminated tonight in my one of my mates brothers squaring up to me and challenging me to some masculine ego contest. How? Well it appears that he took the fact that i threw a snowball at him in a snowball fight a little seriously.... this, despite being a little petty, seems like the argument i shouldn't have to have with a grown man. Alas it seems that he feels the need to construct a huge ball of ice to throw at me to excact his revenge. This he threw at my chest later in the evening as i was walking home to get my takeaway.... he obviously failed to take into account that ice breaks when it hits me. So it left him feeling more stupid than if he'd ave done nothing and acted like an adult.. i find it ironic that i act more mature than the people around me, who are sometimes five or so years older than me :S. Ah well, it will continue to puzzle me i spose. Laters

Credit today Keith spent a large majority of the day lokign around for places in which to buy credit. Keith is now tired and wants to a) kill the head-chief of orange b) sleep c) wash down his pasty with something resembling liquid The tale of his adventures is long and winding... but it will be written anyway. (also as he is bored, Keith will be writing this whole post in the third person..... enjoy :P) He was informed that the shop across the road, a respectable tesco's express would have credit. With this knowledge and then money he now had acquired from parents and his account, Keith charged across the road into the small breeze that had begun to form. ....Keiths family were liars, they had "run out" of orange credit, and along witht his - all the pamphlets for electronic top-up cards had, had their contents swiped, without them being replenished. Keith then retruned home ... to his house and scabbed a lift from his brother who happened to be going to town with his biatch. They dropped him off at the newer tescos as this was convenint for them.. not so for keith. He walked inside and tried to purchase credit here, to be told that orange no longer did vouchers and that withoud an e-top up card he was like a welsh sheep.... buggered. (any oppertunity i know) Keith Registered his top-up card and mashed the key pad on his phone in a ain attempt to understand this strange piece of equipment. Twenty minutes were allowed to pass to make sure the card had registered properly, he walked into the shop and tried valiantly to buy some credit. He was shot down as the person told him the card did not work. Angered, but not giving up he decided to run into town and get some from the orange shop. This was when he discovered the gentle breeze had changed into a violent wind... which he was now walking into. Suffice to say it took a bit longer than usual to get into town. He eventually arrived, walked to the orange shop, for they would surely have the credit he so dearly seeked?!? Alas, as it was a sunday, no such luck - the shop was closed. No problem he thought to himself, I shll go to the link instead. Now, for those of you not familiar with the link on a sunday - here's what happens. You have at least seven customers in the shop all wanting to see different phones or to return a malfunctioning one. These are all things that take time and they have a total o *drumroll* ...two staff working. One of these didnt know what he was doing and had to keep asking the other dude to help. Twenty minutes of queuing was enough to annoy him beyond belief as there was no sign of his credit happening any soon. Keith left the link with a mumble of 'fuck this'. His last stop, the last store open, his salvation neared... Woolworths. His quest was nearly over his credit within reach. He gave over his 15quid and recieved his credit. There was much rejoicing. Naute had now been calling for about half an hour, keith felt it necessary to answer this call for if he didn't nature might just pop out and bite his arse of. After this he celebrated - Keith went to superdurg, bought his pastie, started textering and began his walk home. However he had forgotten the wind.... Half an hour later a much tired Keith returned home to his loving... empty house, collapsed onto his bed and started strumming. The end.

The women of scarborough must be very unhappy people. ...'Strange beginning' you may be thinking. You'd be write, it is but there is a reason for it. I was walking around the streets of scarborough last night after I had eaten a large Chicken Biryani and drunk my pint of John smiths... (northerners rock!)... we noticed that a lot of the 20-30 age group had.. certain car modifications. Suffice to say, the men of the area had bigger spoilers than the wings on most planes and they had really huge engines, coincidentally louder than most planes. When the cars roared past us, engines revving I saw the puzzled looks of my parents towards these strange beings and felt the need to translate for them. "The engine is code Mum, - it means 'I have a small penis' " After drinking a bottle of wine between them, they began to tolerate my "humour" and instead of going 'dont be so disgusting' they merely laughed at the unsuspecting townies. Also on another note, the women folk of scarborough are members of the local S.A. (and no i don't mean hitlers force... just think about it) I average 1 in 10 ppl will understand what I mean by this, so just to clear it up. I was being whisteld at when walking along the front by 20 yr olds and the evening dress was of belt sized proportions. ...Ya get it yet? What else... oh yes. Turns out i drove all the way up to scarborough, to spend the rest of the time i was there driving round looking at houses and areas. I've done more u-turns than a gay plumber ... wait that doesnt make sense!! ...ah well... Suffice to say i was not best pleased. The food was cool, everything is soo much cheaper. Breakfast - full english including: sausage, eggs, bacon, beans, fried bread and toast for a couple of quid - not like the shit you get at tesco either. This was followed by lunch - a freshly cooked half baquette, filled to the brim with cooked pork and fried onions, all coated in a shiteload of apple sauce..... quite why I'm writing down my culenary habits/tastes is beyond me.. But hey - my blog, my rules. Plus i've spent two day s chowing down on more sweets and mints ... and now rock (the seaside kind, not the granite kind) and I am on a liiiiie bit of a sugar high. I've actually had the urge to go WEEEEEEEEEEEE but didn't, as I have got some small remainder of dignity left. What have I learned from my time in scarborough? Well all of the arcades are still tehre that I kne when i was yonug, aslas the golf course has been dug up to be used as sea wall protection. My dreams of playing guitar on the beach may soon be becoming a reality and I leave you all with a thought. Do not be afraid of change. Without change we would never evolve. Laters

For once on valentines day i was not my bitter old-man-ish kinda self. So that was fun. A lot of time , I have noticed I am labelled at my school as being "depressed". I have noticed this more over the past weeks, that when I'm not depresed - when I am in fact quite the oppostite. (ooh the clash of tenses =/). This is quite an annoyance to me for some reason, I find it annoying having people go 'You always so depresed'... no I'm not, and how does me making a stupid and vulgar joke then qualify that statement to come into being. After all I am going up to scarborough mid week to look at areas that might be nice to live in.. so ten hours in a car there and back to look forward to =/. ... sigh ... Anyway.. Happy, Happy!!. Despite what you all may think of my persona, how i piss, moan, take apart your lives, am pessimistic, cynical and al in all a dour bugger.. I am actually happy :D:D for reasons you all know, and if you don't - good. Your obviously paying more attention to your life than the lives of others - go you *thumbs up*. Either that or your on the wrong page and in that case *loads shotgun* ... doors to you left* *taken from ..the place of genius News: I am going through a nirvana phase atm and am learning a lot of stuff, as well as improving my chords change-overs.. so thats fun. I'm gonna have to get a job soon, my money is going down the metaphorical shitter faster than vindaloo the morning after a stag night. (queue the 'EWW' from several people) Speaking of vindaloo, how many ppl have tried it/actually like it? I have never had the pleasure of eating this intriguing dish, but that doesnt stop me comparing it to eating lava. The reports were put together on thurs, which is really jsut an excuse for us to think up elaborate ways to hide our bad grades from our parents (one of the thigns this school has right). In reality it is their way of geting cheap labour to sort out all of the reports into pilews in alphabetically order... did i say 'cheap'? I meant free... Oil prices incerase as the taxes go up once again fo- .... oh wait I forgot, the news has to be dummed down. I am probably alone in this - I watch the news. I say this without shame.. well with a little shame, but in the mornings i watch it and hear al the important events and aspects of the government etc. that are important to my day. At dinner time however I am bombarded with another kind of "news" , news of a cats great strugle to crawl aloong a large pipe. Or how kids from some primary school have managed to make a mosaic on one of their classrooms walls. This begs teh questoin, 'Why should I care', it's the news becoming more 'in-tune- with the common peopl.. but its gone one step too far and is dealing with pap I would expect from you've been framed or some such thing... wow i can actually rant about anything =/ i'll stop before i go overboard.. again Laters

It's quarter to ten as i start to write. I find myself where I usually am at this time of the evening - here at my computer. My dad is playing Call of Duty downstairs and my mum is asleep, my bros out somehwere either working or ... well not doing much. My guitar is across my lap awaiting some strumming, but my finger callouses are gieting kinda thick, and some are kinda sore from a mixture of frantically trying to learn chord change-overs and stuff. My novel starts its ... second chapter (can't really find the right timulus to write atm) and I sit here in ponderance. It seems that at a certain age when hormones kick into overdrive (...in other words the 15-17 age group) we spend the majority of our lives trying to define them. We, as a whole I have noticed spend a lot of time worrying about what other people think/say/do/ and have started to focus to much on other people and their opinions. Where have the times of tenagers rebelling against the norm? It appears that it has died, replaced with a huge mass of people all trying to fit in with their various social groups. You have the kevs, the greebo's, the stoners, the bitches, the punks etc... and with each of them you get the nice little group called the "wannabe whatevers". We spend to much time analysing what we think we "should" be, not on what we actually want to do. ("OH THE IRONY!!" I hear you cry, well ... before you say anything I know :P ) I mean, fuck. How many of you wan't to be sat at a computer reading this right now? You're doing it out of boredom, right? I do it all the time, you can always tell when someones been home from school, cos they leave comments everywhere on all the sites. Think, think about what you really wish you were doing right now. Think as to what that would be, or who you would rather be with..... and go for it. NO WORrYING!! I am giving everyone who reads this the ability to veto any consequences. Remember if you don't think there are any consequences, then there aren't any. Reach out and do what you want to do for a change, forget everyone else and what they may think of you for doing it, forget about yourself and your image - do it. A lot of you have probably clicked on the cross/lowered your opinon of me/backed away from the computer by now so this will mean nothing and I will be talking to myself.... "Hey Keith" " 'Sup man?" "Not muc.. You watch the liverpool game?" "Yer i did, weren't half bad, although they still haven't quite recovered from their injury problems. Until they get their full-strength squad back, I don't think they're gonna challenge the top 3" "Hm... true..." "You know it, by the way do you have my cd's? I can't find them anywhere" "Best check with the other Keith, I only exist on tuesdays and wedsnesdays. You want saturday through monday Keith." "Righto, I'll check with him when I next imagine him" Well, I had a huge rant at the beginning, so I thought I'd better counterract it by going very nearly insane... just to balance out the universe and make sure the Earth doesn't collapse in on itself or summat. ....What to do, what to say... I'm tired, I should really be doing my chmistry coursework, but I felt obliged to keep up my blog and keep you informed of the in's and out's of my life. Except, that's never what I talk about on here, not in the slightest in actual fact. Strange in a way... ah well that's me in a nutshell. OOh... one thing before I go. You at the back! Don't think I can't hear you sigh... I have eyes in the back of my head.... (How comethey never see us swear at them then?) It is, yet again about people. Why do people who you make quite clear of your dislike to... still find it necessary to engage you in conversation? I mean, seriously... why bother? It just makes both of you annoyed and want to try and kill small animals with HUGE..... beards. Before i go, a list of themale gentialia Penis, wang, shlong, sausage, pencil, hose, one eyed monster, snake, trouser-snake, manhood, cock, dick, willy, wife's best friend, meat and two veg, crown jewels, manly material, pogo stick of pleasure, maypole... ok I got bored and am making my own ones up. I bid thee adieu, it is 20 past ten. That was a way to rid myself of boredom and help put my oxygen-depreived brain to sleep. G'night

The search for boots.... or 'my saturday of stress' ] "You can get anything you want in Aylesbury... As long as your average size, have a lot of money and get into the store at 9am before they've run out of stock" - a fellow cynic In Aylesbury, it has become increasingly difficult for a man of my stature to by attire. I needed to buy some rugby boots, so I of course went to the first logical place, JJB. I went straight for their selection of 4 different rugby boos .. at least this was what I thought. Turns out that they were all the same boot.. just a slightly different colour. Even so i felt obliged to try them on and ordered a pair of size 11 shoes. For those of you who have not had the pleasure of seeing my feet.... they are quite wide, wider than these ones anyway as i needed clown length shoes to actually fit my girth into them. (yes that was just a por excuse to get the word 'girth' into my blog, if you don't like it.. then go screw a goat... or even worse, a gecko. They can bite like mutha-fuckas) I went next to jakemans, which was closed. Then to allsports where they were most ingenious in their ways of enticing customers. They display on their racks three diferent styles of rugby boot, all of which would have been wide enough for my mutant feet. Alas, this was a ploy to get people into the store as I soon realised after 10 minutes of waiting for them to find any of the rugby boots in the store produced nothing. Eventually the dude looking for them got the manager to look for me... before returning twenty minutes later to say 'Wed ont sem to have any rugby boots at all...' 'Then why do you display them here dickwad?' ... i didnt of course say that as my father was present and he ould have beaten me with a hoover nozzle when we returned home. Instead i just said 'No worries bruv' and left, shaking my head at them. In the end i went to Oxford, bought some football bootsa as i could not be arsed with looking for any more to fit me. The end. Groovy Remember kiddies, your not arrogant.... everybody else is stupid *dies*. I have now (in english.. and every other lesson really =/) developed this aura of pessimism and cynicism. I am far less pessimistic than I used to be and am not, as foster said "Why bother going to the sea side..... the sea'll probably swallow me up anyway..." I have NEVER been this bad.. thats greg scott erritory *shudders*. As for the cynicism.... i fully admit to that, but i prefer the term 'realist'. I may look at humanity with a critical eye, but I see no reason why I shouldn't. A cynic is defined as: A person who believes people's motives are usually bad or selfish. In that case, yes. I am indeed a cynic, cuff me officer. No it isn't a crime yet... but cuff me ayway ;) *shudders* THE POINT! Thee was one i was planning on getting to.... Ah yus, I am a cynic and we believe that a lot of people's actions are selfish or have other means than the proposed ones. *Stops before going on a rant about the government.* This does not mean however that we think everyone does this. We know that some people are thoroughly genuine and due to our many years experience, we can tend to notice these people more than other people. (rhis aint a golden rule though, we all have our bad days). Do not judge us, we do but walk among you... that mand in the peaked cap, that woman at the bus stop and yes.. even the young woman with the pram who eyes you suspiciously as you walk past. These could all be biting cynics.. beware. On a final note, Y'know those glasses on a long handle posh women use at the opera and such? A cookie to the first person to give me their real name. Answers in shout out form or on the back of a stamped, addresed swallow. Pelicans will also be accepted.

What have I been up to I hear.... no one cry. Well I'm gonna tell ya anyway because I have nowt else to do. On Wednesday I went to "play" rugby sevens at Roslyn Park in Londium. This was the national tournament and over a few days has 837 games. We started the day by having all thirteen of us pile into the green minibus, for those of you not aware of the green mionibus, it's propbably older than most of your houses. It has one bar in the roof that rattles... now when i say "rattle".. I mean vibrates back and forwards rapidly causing a very loud noise, similar to a jackhammer. Well, thats what it sounded like at 7a.m. anyway. This would happen everytime we stopped in traffic and the only way to remedy this was to hold the bar steady with your arm. Suffice to say, in M25 London traffic, there were some sore arms by the end of the journey. The journey weren't too bad as I had stolen the seat that actually has leg room and so I didn't develop deep vein thrombosis or it's long distant cousin .. death (why not?). However we were quite a way into the jounrey when we realised our 13... was supposed to be a 14. "Where's Payne?" Came the question from the back of the bus. "Well he's right ... erm... shit. Sir, we forgot Payne." We phoned Payne with one of the phones and pulled over into the Layby, fifteen minutes (and much rattling from the bar) later, he arived and the journey continued. The day drew on, much as days tend to do and it was not long before the first game... which I didnt play in, but fret not! I told myself, I would play in the second. And I did... not that I did much =/. We lost all of our three games and my contributions to the match I played in was to hand one person into the ground and offload the ball.... and being kicked in the face. It was an... eventful day to say the least... Oh, on a .. kind of related subject, I have now been playing rugby since year 9 for the school.. and over that period the only trys I have scored have been for house and in training. For the school, I have scored a grand total of... *Drumroll*... No Trys, much to Fosters disgust. I have got colours for sport twice, but I've never scored *seethes*.... Ah well. Anyway, that was a brief tale of my day of rugger (goes into old speak). It was a jolly spiffing time I must say, I almost felt like old Mortimer as he won on the 5 for 1 at Whitchester *dies*. We have just been told the topic of this years house writing is 'Survival', so thats gonna be fun. Now, how to write something about survival without incorporating guns... Laters, I'm off to do the shiteload of work I now have amassed
