Instead they have been replaced with what I can only say (with a heavy heart) to be ....*sighs*.... pop. Instead of the good old raps in Valley of Chrome and Dr. Greenthumb and instead we have.... 'Whats ya name, Whats ya number? I'd like to get to know you....' Two minutes silence starting... now.

Haven't updated in awhile due to several hundreds of thousands of technical difficulties. First off - my dad installed a virus software to try and stop him recieving so many worm viruses. This in turn stopped me from using the internet randomly and if i could get it to work, it was slower than a dead man walking up Mt. Everest. Then, lo nd behold., my dads computer got a worm virus and had to be totally wiped. That took two days. When the computer returned - the network did not work so i had to curse and hit and stuff to try in vain to get it to. Finally, miraculously my father managed to realise that eh had installed to much firewall software in his paranoia and decided to let me have the internet back. Stoke Mandeville. This was a place that I had often (foolishly) thought of as being just down the road from Aylesbury. If you to think of it like this... then i suggest that you try walking there. Five miles (give or take). I decided that I would walk to visit Rach at work and alleviate some of her tedium. I thehn, upon ariving in town realised that I had forgotten where this place was. I then realiwsed it was in Mandeville and set off to walk to the hospital. Upon arriving there i had but another 2 miles to walk as a nice passer -by informed me and i set off on a jog. All in all an hours worth of exercise, altho jogging on the whole is a sport I discourage to anyone thinking of taking it up. (disjointed thought pattern you may think. 'Damn straight' says I) http://www.penny-arcade.com/view.php3?date=2004-03-19&res=l ^ go here to learn the internet fuckwad theory. This is why we have to put up with complete and uter twats in our lives on the internet. Yawn,. i have more to say, but it can wait laters

One thing I did forget to add. At lunch yesterday I brought the fruit that is compulsory at my house *cough* bollocks *cough*. We were hungry, but when aren't we? Anyhow I brought two (rather small) apples for me and my brother to eat. To which my brother said, "Well one's these big definately didn't hit Einstein in the head..." A few minutes.. and some choice words later my brother realised the error of his ways. I think it's fitting to now quote Einstein, "There are only two infiite things in this world. The universe and human stupidity, but I'm not sure about the former." It may be a little off, but it's the best I can do off the top of my head. Laters (see below for real post)

I'm not one to refuse a pretty lady... So when Ollie asks me to blog, blog I must do. *dies* So what have I been up to ya big ol cockney barrel of monkeys. The answer: Revision The ones among you that know me the most wil most likely have burned your tounge on your take-out food or fallen off your chair when reading that. Actually, you'll probably be out having a social life in your holidays and not sat inside your house reading this tepid drivel. ...Anyhoo, my life this week has consisted of eating, sleeping and socialising. Well, I went out on wednesday and spent the majority of my life two places that I spend most of my time in. For those of you not with cryptic battery packs added to your brain (God missed them out on some of the later models, apparently they make you explode...pfft what does he know) I've been at mine or rachael's. It's been a good week, especially the getting up late parts... that is something I enjoy a lot :-D. As for revision, yes I'm back on the point. (Aren't tangents great?) Revision is especially hard for men to do. We do not have the capacity to stare at books for over a five minute period, whereas women can. This I know is a crass generalisation for many of the female of the species cannot revise either, and to the i say.. Kudos! We should not be revising, we should be out doing crazy drugs, having crazy sex and enjoying the sunshine. That is .. if there were any sunshine. "April showers" my family call it. "God laughing at us" is a more fair description. He is a twisted individual isn't he? I can actually imagine the scenario in heaven: St. Peter: Aaaah summer's here again God, finally the people of Britain can leave their houses. St. Paul: Yes, especially after that dreadful rain they've been getting. St. Peter: They must love the break, not having to wear three layers of worrying about getting wet. God: *Evil glint enters eye* Heh..heh.heh.. St. Peter: Erm... Sir? God: *Kicks black clouds* Fly my pretties, fly... Or something. Oh and in reference to the black clouds, they are not being kicked because they are balck but because they have rain contained within them. It was no a racial slur in any way, shape or form. Bloody political correctness. On another note, I bought 'magic and medicine' by the Coral, it's brilliant. Yes. No critique here, just telling you to buy it now, or wait until woolies have one of those copies with no cover or book like I did. On the vein of music, I have 2.50 left in my bank account (it is related, honest!) with which to buy an acoustic guitar to replace my now infamous crappy one that I leant to the kids on D of E. Heh, suckers. The cheapest acoustic (although quite a nice one) is 79.99pounds. Hence my dilemma. I could buy a crappy one from argos for twenty quid... but I don't even have that :-S. Ah well.. c'est la vie. I return to my computer five minutes later, forgetting that I had been writing a blog. The mind works in mysterious ways, doesn't it? Where was I now... nope lost it. Ah well, Just watched finding nemo again. Quite possible one of the best animated fish films of all time, second only to Sharky and George, I know it wasn't a film.. but it doesn't matter. Anyhoo, enjoy your Easter with all your eggs while I have my .. two at most to look forward to. Don't get fat now, it'll only cause havoc with your health later in life. The on the call Davi- ..erm Keith. Yes, Keith.

I'm tired. I'm tired of stripping wallpaper and painting walls I'm tired of packing up things so I can move I'm tired of making sure my room is spotless I'm tired of D.T. coursework and pursuing 'The best can achieve' I'm tired of being bollocked when I've done nothing wrong I'm tired of parents treating teenagerdom as a disease I'm tired of the old ways of thinking that people just can't let go I'm tired of having to do what others tell me I'm tired of stupid people I'm tired of having to tolerate people I hate I'm tired of being tired al the time I'm tired of having anything I say shot down in flames I'm tired of small children I'm tired of restraining myself from hitting people I'm tired of being laughed at I'm tired of being ignored I'm tired of my body not working properly I'm tired of not understanding people I'm tired of being told to 'be sociable' I'm tired of revision I'm tired of shades of blue I'm tired of not being black I'm tired of not having any money I'm tired of arguments I'm tired of intolerant people (oh the irony!) I'm tired... Physically and mentally. Today I have done the following: Tidied out my brothers parking space at his flat. This involved -Raking four bin bags worth of leaves and putting them into said bags -Picking out the trash (crisp packets, carrier bags) from the place and binning them -Picking weeds and bramble out of the newly fond soil with my hands (I say newly found soil... because nobody knew it was there. It was buried deep underneath a pile of crap a foot dep. Consequently the pile of crap I had to move.) Then came the bush trimming. My brothers wheely bin had become encovered by a bramble bush with centimetre to inch long thrns all over it. I had to -Chop the bush back a few feet.. scratchin myself a plenty -Pick up the bits of bush and place them into bags -Repeat until parents satisfied -Count number of limbs remaining Luckily the other bush that was in the way off the door had no thorns, so was trimmed easier Next job. Painting. Two walls in the room had been donw.. leaving two walls with the window and several plug sockets and fernickety edges to paint around. This led to much annoyance as I was using the roller. This took an hour and a half to paint fully with my brother neatening the edges that i couldn't have managed with the shitty 'cotton wool on a swirly stick' i had been given. That was an end to the physical part of my day except for the loading, next came the mental part. I had to draw a plan and measure my brothers room, as well as travelling home and measuring all of his furniture. Now i had to piece the two together, bearing in mind all radiators/plugs/light switches. This sounds easy, but it is not. My brother neglected to tel me that his stuff would only fit in with a nanometer of space left to breathe. This led to me drawing sums and doing advanced sums in my head... and cocking them up. I mean seriously, who can do pythagoras thereom of three digit numbers in their head? This led to me phoning people for use of their calculator, thankyou especially to ben and emma for whom 'two minutes' ... means never. Eventually due to help from raquel i had my sums... and found out I didn't have enough room. Fuck. Thre plans later and I've fitted everything in the room.. but the double bed has to have one of it's sides up against the wall.... ah well they can live with it. Oh, apparently I was supposed to ring emma back... ah well shite happens Im continuing in my mentally tired state by playing emotional table tennis with half of the population of southern england. That and it's ten and I really need to sleep (yes i'm needing earlier and earlier nights) Yawn laters

Long time.... nothing My internet has been down and to be frank, I'm lucky to be on here right now. On similar news, I hate my network. I also need to learn it, answer the questions and maybe make an attempt at learning some conversation topics.. but nah. I fear I am becoming more insane.. I also fear that the sentence: 'All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy' is much underused in the common climate. On other, more musical news I have recently acquired a new musical instrument that I can add to my room of instruments that I hope to have when I'm older. Random yes, it cost five quid and my rents bought it at an auction... they were originally bidding for a guitar for me btu it went for too much. Obviously an accordian is the next guess =/ On other music related news - Santana rock, as does the new Beastie Boys single. It's great go out and get it... NOW! I have not shyed away in my love for the beasties, they're great as many people will back me in saying.... now if only the were black like us. I'm enjoying the new D12 album, especially a track that surprised me called 'The good die young' where the group pay homage to all of the people they know that have died over the years and about how they miss them etc. It surprised me that they've got emotioal.. well emotions, but it was a welcome surprise so you know that all those big boy rappers aren't always popping pills and raping each others mothers. I now move onto ..rage. Rage directed at emals like this: (I've higlighted the bits i love in bold) "if you think this is a laugh you are actually wrong! if you do not send this email on to 15 people tonight you will have an old lady appear beside you while you are sleeping and you when you awake and open your eyes she will stare at you for a long long time and if you look away she will crawl onto you and start eating your body very very slowly and you will die a very painfull death and the quicker you look away the more pain you will be! if you think it is a joke think again if you think you are so good and will delete this email believe me i warned you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! " Where to start, except for the lack of commas, full stops and the fact that the word in s missed off the end... However it isn't the bad spelling and gramar that annoys me the most. It's the fact that someone is at home beating off* over the fact they have made a shitty email circle the globe. *may just be laughing or smug. So, join me in my vision of no more of these type of emails. Next time you are sent one of these, reply to it and tell them how annoyed you get when you recieve twenty seven of them a day. The worst one is the hotmail one, when you think about them logically... they're just bullshit. Anyhoo... only a week left lads... The tale of the bed There are some manky things in any new house, so we have been stripping these out one by one... but nothing prepared me for one item of furniture. (Warning, may be distrubing for younger readers.. that means you *points*) This bed was, to be frank, stained an off brown colour - that was just the mattress. After we took this off and threw it in the 'room of miscillaneous crap to be thrown out' (a lengthy name, but fitting) we discovered the bed. This bed was... a greeny yellow colour. Now this would have had to have soaked through the mattress and then stain the bed. The bed was crap anyway, but this was a bit drastic. After taking the head board off, which had been broken at some stage and was nailed back on with another piece of wood, we discovered a vodka bottle - a clue as to why this had happened. Lots of pushing and groaning and the bed was downstairs int he trailer, ready to go to the tip. This process was followed by many washings of my hands. I went to my new college today and, to my suprise was greeted on something like the level of a human being. Now this may be shocking to you AGSers, but the people here a quite friendly. You call the teachers by their first names, get 8 free periods a week and wear whatever you feel like. I shook hands with mike, I don't know what job he does exactly but he did my 'chat'. I go in for 6 subjects on wednesday and get lost because i took directions from two 'bigger boys' who didn't like my accent. ...or something. (on another note, over half my emails now i had were spam) I met my physics teacher (possibly) and had a talk with him about science and rugby/basketball. Friendly people. It looks to be an allright place. I have a new favourite shop - Cash Converters. It rocks, they have more amps than god and they're huuuge. That and loads of guitars, dvd players, cd's, games and hi-fis etc. It's porbably where i'll get my new guitar from, from my new job. This is all theoretical 'cos i haven't applied or got it yet. But that's tomorrows job. It's 20 hours a week, five days a week for five quid an hour. Hundred pound a week baby :-D. Anyhoo.. gotta go. Buh bye

Anyhoooooo, I am a little tired, i'll try and steal this again soon so i can type up random incessant babble. Oh yeah, THREE - NIL.. THREE - NIL! It has been a long time A really long time. I write this on my brothers computer at the flat of dreams and mystery. The internet is free AOL and is 56k, go me! What has happened. Well I'm settled in here now, I've got my computer up, ps2 up and my cd's and dvd's are being taken out of their packing when needed. I have a few clothes and some comfy arse chairs to watch tv on. Only thre weeks more of living here to go, before move number two. I can't play music very loud as it disturbs the neighbours as we found out 7.3o one morning when the guy above us turned his music on full blast. He'd forgotten there was no-one beneath and later gave us a bottle of Jasons Creek to apolagise. Nice bloke. I have a new acoustic, to make up for the fact my electric guitar and amp are in boxes. It's a crafter d6, and it is sweet. Although Ben just told me i could have it 30quid cheaper of the internet, but hey ya can't win em all. I live near a large pond/small lake which is cool to walk the dog and chill, but I have been finding study leave boring, with my mobile phone's ever decreasing credit being pretty much my only form of communication. On a plus side there's always the english exam tomorrow to look forward to..... The football on Sunday, hopefully will be in the afternoon so Ill be back home from a car boot sale. I'm gettting rid of all my crap, it takese up two cars and a trailer roughly. Also I'll get to see my dad again who i Haven't since my Cousins 21st last friday. That means I have to give up my double bed (which fucking rocks!!!) for the sofa. C'est la vie. 56k sucks. It is one thing I'm missing along with cable, money and social activities. My cousins twenty first was fun though. It's always good to see your relatives get drunk and your annoying aunt fall over when trying to get into the house. (My mum literally couldn't walk, it was priceless.. if annoying). Then my bro and is gf went to their room and me and my cousin watched tenacious d live until 3 in the morning. It was a good evening. My cousin rocks, if i could have a trade-off for bro.. no contest. Am I joking? You decide. Where shall i travel in my brain next. Oh yes the 'everyone vs wardi' thing on bens blog, I don't care if it's a closed aregument.. Ward's wrong. ...What? .. What are you doing here..? Put it down.. no.. * click * No, no...NOOOO!!! * BANG * ... * thud * Anyhoo.. How do the exams go for everyone? I seem to be unworried, despite having done diddley-squat revision. (yes it is a word. I blame my lack of concentration on my appauling hayfever which has come upon me tenfold like the seventh plague of hell... or something. My eyes burn, my nose streams or doesn't work at all and i can't get to sleep in the heat. God bless england, the sooner I'm living by a beach the better. (Sea air and water cleans my hayfever right up, it also cures virtually every illness i've ever suffered. My asthma used to lessen and Ecsma/exma/exsma or however you spell it would disappear.) '....I'm just a poor boy nobody loves me... HE'S JUST A POOR BOY FROM A POOR FAMILY, SPARE HIM HIS LIFE FROM THIS MONSTROSITY' I'm reduced to listening to the 'air guitar' compilations.. sigh Until next time folks

Hello Southerners *dies* There is a language barrier between the north and south (no, i'm not bothering with my usual blathering introduction to my insane rantings.. instead i'd have a nice long pair of brackets like this you see here... Fetching isn't it, i was afraid it'd make the page look fat...) *dies* So anyway, language. For example, how many of you have heard the word 'ace' used in a conversation like the following: "My old english teacher is on the bloody beach" "I remember him, he was ace." Or "Mmmm.. bacon." "Love it with a bit of brown sauce, really ace that is." Weirdo's.. plus the word grand is used to describe things oter than a thousand quid. Whatever. "What," i hear you cry, "has become of myself?" .... *silence* .. Well i don't care, even though it is insanely boring. I've painted, built beds, stripped wallpaper, glossed skirting boards, filled holes, sanded wood and filler. Ripped up carpet, put carpet down, lifted and shifted washing machines, beds, mattresses, tumble drier, fridges, tables and many, many other things. Been to the laundrette twice, baught a new cooker, been down the pub a few times, went to the beach and played footy. As well as playing final fantasy X.. In other words, I'm bored off my tits. On the plus side i went to 'ROCK ON THE BEACH 2004' *cue echo effect* the music was alright, with Reactor and Thunder being the two best bands. Imagine the darkness, but with a different lead singer who actually sings as opposed to warbles weirdly. (i don't hate the darkness before i get anyone bitching.) Then make the music a little less main stream (ie. get rid of the singles) and you've got thunder. Or something pretty damn close. Anyhoo, have to go now. Buh bye.
